item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, September 27, 2024 at 1:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. It's hard to write code for computers, but it's harder to write code for humans (94 points | 29 comments)
2. Legalizing Sports Gambling Was a Mistake (629 points | 562 comments)
3. TSMC execs allegedly dismissed OpenAI CEO Sam Altman as 'podcasting bro' (228 points | 194 comments)
4. CouchDB 3.4.1 Released (33 points | 14 comments)
5. End of an era: Landsat 7 mission takes final images (229 points | 42 comments)
6. I Am Tired of AI (463 points | 472 comments)
7. I have 2000 old VHS tapes in my garage and don't know what to do with them (265 points | 234 comments)
8. Hacking Kia: Remotely controlling cars with just a license plate (503 points | 305 comments)
9. Two kinds of LLM responses: Informational vs. Instructional (45 points | 6 comments)
10. Vanilla OS 2: an immutable distribution to run all software (131 points | 39 comments)
11. Small3dlib: Suckless PD 3D software rasterizer (203 points | 82 comments)
12. A pilot project in universal algebra to explore new ways to collaborate (163 points | 20 comments)
13. Why are my ZFS disks so noisy? (120 points | 27 comments)
14. HP injects AI into its printers (8 points | 3 comments)
15. Imbue (YC S17) Is Hiring a Founding Product Engineer ( | hide)

17. FCC unlocks spectrum to support advanced satellite services (121 points | 62 comments)

19. Sony, Ubisoft scandals lead to California ban on deceptive digital goods sales (224 points | 76 comments)
20. Implementing and Detecting Anti-Debugging with Fork() (38 points | 10 comments)
21. The ambition of Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 (130 points | 99 comments)
22. I've tracked every piece of clothing I've worn for three years (2021) (117 points | 158 comments)
23. So Many Silver Landmines (5 points | 1 comment)
24. Attacking UNIX Systems via CUPS (384 points | 280 comments)
25. Nardwuar on his best and worst interviews (115 points | 35 comments)
26. In the Shack with Robert Caro (20 points | 16 comments)
27. Dethrace: Reverse engineering the 1997 game "Carmageddon" (2023) (82 points | 30 comments)
28. Stem cells reverse woman’s diabetes (246 points | 34 comments)
29. Turning OpenAI into a Real Business Is Tearing It Apart (10 points | 2 comments)
30. Malicious SHA-1 (2014) (64 points | 11 comments)
